fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Culture, Education and training, Enlargement, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations, Communication, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives:
In.Europa is a new type of organization (we start on this year) which  concentrated on the most important topics for Europe and try to introduce to public. 
 
The fields of our interest are: rule of law, foreign and security policy, education, general and institutional matters, economic and financial matters.
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit:
In.Europa 
is a new type of an innovative, pro-European organization 
 
do tank, not think tank: 
we want to select the topics of most importance for Europe successfully introduce them into the public debate, 
we do not want to produce new reports legible only to a limited group of experts 
 
civic perspective: 
we want to deal with areas of life wherein the Union brings tangible benefits to its citizens, 
we do not want to view the Union in isolation from the reality surrounding us 
 
pro-european attitude: 
we believe in the European project and in the ways it has benefited Poland and the Poles, 
we do not want force ourselves to represent phony objectivism 
 
smart organization: 
a small, flexible team, boldly facing the challenges with the support of experienced colleagues can achieve more, 
we do not need to immediately create a big office with dozens of employees 
 
design attitude: 
we intend to develop by analyzing specific issues pertaining to the Union 
we do not want to deal exclusively with grand ideas – though we also believe in them
relevant_communication:
State Power Index: We created a state power index to show two phenomena: how Poland’s position has changed on the international arena since 1989 and what the potential power of the European Union can be. As we face growing uncertainty in the world and a risk of a reshuffle of the global order, it is worth seeking to have the EU play a greater international role than today. This is especially the case because of Europe’s numerous external and internal threats and the alternative to integration are uncontrolled and unpredictable developments in the world. 
 
For more info visit: http://index.ineuropa.pl/en/ 
 
The conference Europe Day. The European Parliament, Heart of European Democracy? which was taken place on Wednesday, 9th May 2018 at the Centrum Nauki Kopernik, Warsaw. 
The aim of the conference was to explore in-depth and exhaustively the issue of liberal democracy and the role of European Parliament just year ahead of the European elections. In this context, the participants of the conference were discuss the future of Europe. 
 
For more info visit: http://ineuropa.pl/day-of-europe/ 
 
Moreover we are organized seminar on the UE future.
